column4: Wrapped up our Southern Illinois Agriculture Tour in Scheller at John Kabat’s farm to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on the pork industry and increasing local food markets. Thanks to all of the farmers and producers who met with us this week! https://t.co/2nH4PMOpK7
I visited with Tom Miller from Marion on Tuesday as part of my Southern Illinois Agriculture Tour. We talked about assistance for livestock producers impacted by COVID-19. https://t.co/XnWngGkmgO

Small businesses are the backbone of our Southern Illinois economy. I’m honored to receive the @NFIB’s Guardian of Small Business Award and will keep fighting to ensure our small businesses get the help they need to recover from the COVID-19 shutdown. #smallbizguardian https://t.co/AyxekJUQm7

Over the weekend, the Jackson County Health Department cleared me to end my quarantine. I am feeling good and getting fully back to work today. Looking forward to seeing folks across Southern Illinois in the coming days!

This morning, I hosted a Women in Agriculture call with several of our Southern Illinois female industry stakeholders. We discussed the USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program, ethanol, and trade, and they gave me an update on how harvest is going. https://t.co/O8CVN5hS6C
It’s always great to catch up with the folks at the @bellevillenewsd. This morning, I spoke with @kelseylandis about recovering from COVID-19. https://t.co/8yDsX64sK7

COVID-19 UPDATE: Happy to report that all of the staff I’ve interacted w/closely in recent days has tested negative for COVID-19. Everyone on the team is feeling good & is symptom free. Tracy & I are continuing our recovery at home & should be good to go once our quarantine ends.

Wanted to reach out and thank everyone for the thousands of well wishes and prayers I have received since announcing my COVID-19 diagnosis last week. Here’s a quick update on how Tracy and I are doing. https://t.co/7zoMhsZQRf

This funding will be used to help ensure that folks who are out of work because of the COVID-19 shutdown have the skills needed to pursue careers in scientific fields. Perhaps the next scientific breakthrough will come from right here in the Metro East! (2/2)

Tracy and I send our prayers for a speedy recovery to @POTUS and @FLOTUS, as well as any other family facing a similar health challenge from this virus. Fortunately, the early indications in the President and First Lady's cases are that the symptoms appear mild.

So. IL steelworkers & manufacturers have long known the importance of producing goods here at home. COVID-19 has only made that more apparent. We must end our dependence on China & ensure meds, PPE & technology are made in America! #CommitmentToAmerica

https://t.co/sU9qSAe3N4 https://t.co/MgqSzVj9Mq

.@HouseGOP has a plan to provide relief to small businesses crippled by COVID-19. The Speaker refuses to allow a vote. We're taking matters into our own hands w/ a discharge petition. This forces a vote whether Pelosi wants it or not; but we need 218 signatures. #FightForSmallBiz https://t.co/xAGL0L8o2P

House Republicans made a #CommitmentToAmerica to defeat COVID-19, keep Americans healthy, and restore our way of life.

Read more about our plan at https://t.co/sU9qSAe3N4 https://t.co/ftru1Qko3K

I’m in DC this week for votes & committee hearings. Today, I started my day with Tony St. James from @AllAgAllDay. We talked all things agriculture – from the @EPA's RFS announcement to @USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program, the Phase 1 China trade deal & USMCA. https://t.co/iMwCbvEElv

As a former truck driver myself, I thank the Southern Illinois truckers who’ve worked around the clock to ensure stores are stocked during COVID-19. I introduced the Truck Parking Safety Improvement Act to ensure they have safe places to park & rest when on the road. #NTDAW (1/2) https://t.co/9KopkeM55r

Today, @USDA announced the 2nd round of the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) designed to assist farmers impacted by COVID-19. Sign-ups begin on Monday, September 21 and run through December 11. Visit https://t.co/XbdeVJUS7o for more info & the application. https://t.co/J4JS2LzVEl

Great meeting with @biofuelresearch’s John Caupert from Waterloo and folks with @GrowthEnergy today as part of their #BiofuelsSummit! We discussed the EPA’s recent RFS announcement, the importance of trade, and the impacts of COVID-19 on our biofuels industry. https://t.co/alGjWxKmvZ

With the Murphysboro Apple Festival postponed b/c of COVID-19, I wanted to share a #tbt from the 1957 festival. It was taken from the 2nd floor of the old Crawshaw’s Funeral Home & if you look closely, you can see my mom & Milton! Mom was 8 months pregnant w/ Debbie at the time! https://t.co/ocd39keBwg

Throughout COVID-19, many families have struggled to keep up with monthly rent payments. @HUDgov has awarded over $3.2 million in CARES Act funding to St. Clair and Madison counties to help prevent families from being evicted during these tough times. 

https://t.co/KaQUX3fHbU

Today’s Hometown Hero is Jadie Johnson from Pontoon Beach. Jadie sewed 3,000 fabric face masks & created a mask pattern for her sewing machine. She shared her pattern online & it's been used to create 10,000 masks! I was honored to recognize her for her work. #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/RnVCvVW8G1

Today's Hometown Heroes are Bobby Robinson & Ken Heidbreder from Swansea, who made intubator boxes for local doctors & hospitals in the Metro East. I was honored to present them w/certificates of recognition for their efforts to support our healthcare workers. #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/dFdjLDUqSO

Every year, 2,000 Illinoisans die from opioid abuse. We must do all we can so more families don't feel the pain of losing a loved one to addiction. @HHSGov has awarded a grant to Rural Health, Inc. in Anna to fight this epidemic, save lives & restore hope. https://t.co/rBUWVNt9WG

When she was forced to close day to day operations because of the COVID-19 shutdown, Leah Maciell & her team started raising funds & donating hundreds of meals to folks in need. I was honored to recognize her for her dedication to our community. #IL12HometownHeroes (2/2) https://t.co/eMeKFOh4pZ

Our next Hometown Heroes are the folks at the Collinsville Food Pantry. Throughout COVID-19, they’ve been working to make sure families are fed & I was honored to recognize them for their efforts. Thank you for your dedication to our Metro East community! #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/uGWyvfzvct

Today’s Hometown Hero is Sparta's Jo Nita Gordon. Working w/ businesses that had extra N95 masks & folks making fabric masks, she organized donations for local hospitals & first responders. Honored to recognize her for her work to keep front line workers safe. #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/afOmFHGZeg

Pleased to share that 5 Southern Illinois health centers have received @HHSGov grants to combat the spread of COVID-19. These grants will provide them with critical resources to keep communities safe and healthy.

More from @kfvsnews ⬇️

https://t.co/DUXeaA9p5q

Every year, millions of tons of cargo is transported along Southern IL rivers, highways & rail. The COVID-19 shutdown hasn’t slowed them down & it hasn’t stopped the work I’m doing in these areas either. Here’s some of the work I’ve done recently as a member of @TransportGOP. https://t.co/NIa4NY8Llg

Birthdays have looked a little different b/c of COVID-19. But that didn’t stop Hometown Hero Angie Judd-Greco from Edwardsville! She organized a group of 800 volunteers to attend birthday parades for kids in Madison Co. Thanks for bringing joy to So. IL kids! #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/maxRlredFj

I cosponsored the Defund Cities that Defund the Police Act, which prevents cities that defund police from receiving certain federal grants. Cases of police brutality or racial injustice should be investigated, but getting rid of police won't make us safer. https://t.co/DPbL3trJCq

Today’s Hometown Hero spotlight is on the Franklin County Farm Bureau! They've been donating hand sanitizer to local police & delivering lunches to folks in need during COVID-19. Thanks to Gay Bowlin & the team at the Franklin County Farm Bureau for your work! #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/C1JalEmQbI

Today's Hometown Hero is Dear Diva Desserts in Columbia. During the COVID-19 shutdown, Bethany & Zac provided free breakfast to folks in need, no questions asked. Honored to present them with a certificate of recognition for their dedication to our community. #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/U2BOW8XtmF

I’ve consistently supported additional funding for USPS, including during COVID-19.
 
If the Speaker truly supports funding USPS, then let’s see if she puts forward a bill that provides the appropriate funding w/o partisan poison pills to score points w/her far left base. (2/3)

The next stop on our Hometown Heroes tour is Carbondale, where I met w/members of the Carbondale/Murphysboro Fabric Mask Response Team! Led by Mary Beth Aguilar, they've made over 12,000 masks for folks in So. IL & across the US. Thank you for your hard work! #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/VgTSyLEUqe

Our doctors & medical professionals have been working around the clock on the COVID-19 front lines to care for their patients. This week, I spoke with @SIHealthcare's president & CEO Rex Budde to get an update on the work SIH is doing to help keep our communities safe & healthy. https://t.co/tpbw262pU8

Yesterday, I visited General Cable in Du Quoin to discuss how they’ve grown their business over the past few years as well as how they are keeping employees safe during COVID-19. Some of the cable they produce at their facility is being used in the southern border wall. https://t.co/EXJKizzb6w

After restaurants closed b/c of the COVID-19 shutdown, they have donated & delivered 14,000 boxes of produce per week to local food pantries & families in need. Rex, Tony & Lance, thanks for all you're doing to feed our community during a tough time! #IL12HometownHeroes (2/2)

Today we kicked off our Hometown Heroes tour, recognizing Southern Illinoisans who have gone above & beyond to help their communities during the COVID-19 recovery. This morning, I spoke with the trio behind Cusumano & Sons: Rex, Tony & Lance Cusumano from Mt. Vernon. (1/2) https://t.co/D5re1jPc8E

Southern Illinoisans have gone above & beyond to keep our communities safe & healthy during the COVID-19 shutdown & they're working just as hard to get our economy back on its feet. This month, I’ll be recognizing some of our Hometown Heroes for their contributions – stay tuned! https://t.co/uB0U9qlI30

Congress sent Illinois $3 billion in federal COVID-19 assistance & Gov. Pritzker continues to ask for more. Yet he has withheld 86% of those funds from being disbursed & refuses to disclose how local govts can access funding. Irresponsible & unacceptable. https://t.co/RR5eTyc89y

The COVID-19 shutdown has strained the resources of our rural communities. I introduced a bill to expand access to emergency funding so these communities can continue providing necessary emergency services & establish additional COVID-19 testing centers. 

https://t.co/IR6ixJ4P6V

I've personally contacted state & federal authorities to get to the bottom of this.  

The COVID-19 shutdown has had a crushing impact on our economy & working families. We need to help the folks who need it. But we need common sense oversight in how funds are distributed. (2/2)

Southern Illinoisans are making the best of a tough situation - from making masks, to organizing socially distant birthday parades, to feeding families in need. More from @thesouthern on how folks are coming together to support their communities.⬇️

https://t.co/cCuO0ZZw3Z

From docs on the front line to folks making masks & providing food to families in need, So. Illinoisans have stepped up to keep our communities safe & healthy during COVID-19.

Do you know someone who has gone above & beyond to help? Let me know here! → https://t.co/rR3iDswdzC https://t.co/U8KJJcswkG

The @USNationalGuard has been working tirelessly to keep our communities safe & healthy. But, many members don't qualify for a VA home loan. I introduced a bill to expand VA home loan benefits to help them & their families purchase a home. https://t.co/p8HVNqcICv

RT @HouseVetAffairs: #Veterans: Do your part and lead by example during this time.

Wear a mask, you could save a life.

This too shall pas…

It's hard for many vets to travel to VA facilities for a disability exam & COVID-19 has only made it more complicated. I introduced a bill to allow specialized care providers to conduct appointments across state lines so vets can get an exam close to home. https://t.co/sXuz0j7U2D

Southern IL veterans: @VAVetBenefits Under Secretary for Benefits Paul Lawrence is hosting a telephone town hall TODAY at 4:00pm central time to discuss COVID-19, the Blue Water Navy Act & the Solid Start program. Veterans interested in participating can call in at 844-227-7557.

While safety is our top priority, we're witnessing a shutdown gone too far. The Grand American trapshooting competition is a time-honored event in So. IL. Banning this year’s event shows a lack of appreciation for how COVID-19 impacts regions differently.
https://t.co/Xbmhi7PQXF

The Republican members of @HouseVetAffairs Subcommittee on Disability Assistance & Memorial Affairs showed that we can balance safety with duty. We took precautions, socially distanced & held an in-person forum on serving vets during COVID-19. We will always show up for our vets! https://t.co/8NtzptVWX6

Important info for Southern Illinois farmers: @USDA is now accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. This program will provide direct relief to farmers & producers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. More info & the application ↓
https://t.co/pXbNowcHq4

Folks in the Metro East – make sure you look out for a flyover from the  932nd Airlift Wing tomorrow! The flight departs from @ScottAFB & will fly over the Metro East to salute health care workers & first responders fighting COVID-19 on the front lines. 

https://t.co/2kjQMVdhXu

Illinois received federal COVID-19 funding nearly a month ago, yet many communities outside of Chicago have not received funding. I joined my Illinois Republican Congressional colleagues in asking Governor Pritzker for more information on how these funds are being allocated. https://t.co/4mlnRzjtEi

Proud to launch Farm Corps to provide job opportunities for unemployed IL veterans by pairing them w/ farmers who have a shortage of on-the-farm labor b/c of COVID-19. Thanks to @ILFarmBureau, Farmer Veteran Coalition of IL & @AgrAbilityIL for their work!

https://t.co/fvvQrq9zfs

Today @USDA announced the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to provide $16 billion in direct payments to farmers & producers. Our farmers work every day so we have food for our tables. Thank you @POTUS & @SecretarySonny for giving them much-needed relief
https://t.co/q3wUaNFqlP

Thank you to everyone who participated in our COVID-19 telephone town hall last night! We covered a wide range of issues including the Phase 4 COVID-19 bill, Governor Pritzker’s reopening plan, and China. https://t.co/BUG0Mfdqn1

Gov. Pritzker recently said he is considering withholding federal COVID-19 funds from local governments if they allow small businesses to reopen ahead of his timeline. My IL GOP House colleagues & I sent a letter urging Congressional leadership to act so this does not happen. https://t.co/177soGardW

Coronavirus relief is not a Democrat or Republican issue. Instead of working together, Speaker Pelosi chose to push forward a liberal wish list of wasteful spending, incentives for illegal immigration, and extreme changes to election law. 

https://t.co/zHPOdurvC4

Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic, truckers have been working to make sure stores are fully stocked. While not perfect, @USDOT’s new Hours of Service rule is an improvement & allows them to better determine when & where to take rest breaks instead of a one-size fits all approach.

On my way to DC to vote against Speaker Pelosi’s phase 4 COVID-19 bill tomorrow. Instead of working across the aisle, the Speaker is pushing a 1,800 page bill drafted w/ zero input from any Republicans. Families & businesses are hurting; now is not the time for political games. https://t.co/vdGmD8pcti

Every year, National Nurses Week comes to a close on May 12th, Florence Nightingale’s birthday. This year, on her 200th birthday, we are especially grateful for the dedicated Southern IL nurses working on the front lines to keep their patients & our communities safe & healthy. https://t.co/4kovIJCvrj

I’m hosting a telephone town hall on Thursday to discuss coronavirus response and relief efforts, reopening Illinois, and the need for Congress to get back to work in DC. 

📞 Thursday at 12:10 PM
❓ What questions do you have?
📋 Sign up to participate at https://t.co/FDJJB0k8zI https://t.co/skHdzFVdVL

ICYMI: @HHSGov has awarded 5 Southern Illinois health centers funding to expand COVID-19 testing. Testing is critical to determining the scale of outbreaks in our communities, which is why I've supported Congressional efforts to expand and improve testing. https://t.co/u1f7ksRDvC

The @IllinoisIDES has launched their portal for self-employed workers and independent contractors to apply for Pandemic Unemployment Assistance. You can find more information about filing a claim on their website https://t.co/6SYu0hIj7o

While in-person classes have been canceled because of COVID-19, teachers are still working hard to educate their students. To all of our Southern Illinois teachers, thank you! #TeacherAppreciationDay https://t.co/QhpTpNqBbK

Important info for Southern Illinois farmers and agricultural producers: @SBAgov is now accepting COVID-19 Economic Injury Disaster Loan and Advance applications on a limited basis. Make sure you submit yours ASAP. https://t.co/RnRHzly2OL

As we continue working to stop the spread of COVID-19, the last thing folks should have to worry about is whether they'll be safe from the virus in their own homes. @HUDgov has awarded 15 Southern IL housing authorities grants to help keep residents safe. https://t.co/UuhExwwtbP

As we work to ensure the health & safety of Southern Illinoisans, it’s clear that COVID-19 is impacting communities across IL in different ways. Governor Pritzker should create a safe, regional & data-driven plan to reopen IL that takes both health & economic needs into account. https://t.co/lKzX3v74vK

.@USDOT awarded over $8 million to @MAAirport
& Veterans Airport of So. IL through the CARES Act & Airport Improvement Program. These funds will help sustain these airports during the COVID-19 pandemic & support jobs for So. Illinoisans working there. 
https://t.co/gcz71tu87z

Thanks to @POTUS @realDonaldTrump & many in Congress, the federal government has taken significant action to protect families & combat COVID-19 in Illinois. Check out my website to see the actions taken & the aid provided by the federal government. https://t.co/LkwtbjUA5f

This afternoon, I participated in a conference call with the Illinois Hospital Association, Senator Durbin, Senator Duckworth, Rep. Shimkus, and hospital leaders across Southern Illinois to discuss hospital readiness and the federal response to COVID-19. https://t.co/VfEavFeQp8

Speaker Pelosi is pushing to create a Select Committee on the Coronavirus Crisis. She wants more bureaucracy, more partisan grandstanding, and another means to attack the president.  The federal government already has eight oversight functions over the COVID-19 response:

Back in DC to approve additional emergency funding for our small businesses and hospitals. Voting will look a little different today as we follow social distancing guidelines, but it’s also vitally important we continue to do our work for the American people. https://t.co/LqAUfSasot

Thank you to our Southern Illinois truck drivers, equipment operators, flight crews, maintenance workers, emergency personnel, and other essential employees who keep America moving. Your hard work has not gone unnoticed. #COVID19 #ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving https://t.co/63EI9hkPCA

Yesterday, 100,000 medical face masks arrived in Illinois from @MOFA_Taiwan. As a member of the Congressional Taiwan Caucus, I'm grateful for Taiwan's generosity as we work to stop the spread of COVID-19. @tecochicago

The FCC is accepting applications for the COVID-19 Telehealth Program. Health care providers can apply for funding to cover the costs of telecommunication & information services & devices so they can provide patients with care through telehealth services. https://t.co/mLcoNqgBAY

The @IDPH has a new free coronavirus mental health hotline. Folks can text “TALK” to 552-020 to be connected with a mental health professional.

The @USDA has a helpful guide for coronavirus resources available for rural communities. More info ↓

Thank you to everyone who participated in our COVID-19 telephone town hall this afternoon, including our special guest, Dr. Josh Miksanek from SIH Herrin Hospital. We covered a lot of ground on COVID-19, including questions about social distancing, testing, and the #CARESAct. https://t.co/DxIJIBbKNn

Over $6.2 million in federal grants are headed to 5 Southern IL health centers to help combat the spread of COVID-19. Thank you to the healthcare workers, our nurses, doctors, paramedics, researchers, and scientists, who are working day in and day out to keep folks safe and healthy. We are grateful for you today and every day. #WorldHealthDay https://t.co/FT24lthzcM

Our local restaurants, coffee shops, and bars are struggling because of coronavirus. Many are continuing to serve their customers in any way they can, including delivery and carry out services. Let's show them our support by suggesting your favorite local eatery! https://t.co/OgOkYio20M

With so much uncertainty and concern surrounding COVID-19, it seems like good news has become harder to find. Well, actor @johnkrasinski has started the @somegoodnews broadcast from his home to remind us of many of the silver linings in the world today. https://t.co/0OHfuljPDI

To the Southern Illinois doctors on the front lines fighting against coronavirus – thank you.

We are grateful for all you do to keep your patients and our communities safe and healthy. #NationalDoctorsDay https://t.co/96SuK9EvGO

I’m sad to share that St. Clair County is reporting a second COVID-19 related death. The patient was in her 30s – a reminder that no one is immune to this devastating illness. Please join Tracy and me in keeping her family in your prayers. https://t.co/hiNfhGT6aw

Sad news from St Clair Co, as IL-12 has its 1st reported COVID-19 death. This tragic loss confirms why it was critical Congress acted swiftly on the #CARESAct. Lives are being lost & we had an obligation to act. Tracy & I send our prayers to the family during this difficult time. https://t.co/ZPuoQUeeMZ

Families are scared; small businesses are struggling; hospitals are fighting an uphill battle. While the bill wasn’t perfect, the consequences of inaction were too high not to support it. We have a long way to go but the more certainty we can restore, the quicker we’ll get there. https://t.co/PooBGUiFkh
I’m here in Washington preparing for a vote on the coronavirus relief bill. Let’s get it done. https://t.co/iI3WyGvz1I
Took a 6am flight back to DC this morning with @RodneyDavis to help pass the coronavirus relief bill. https://t.co/HsWV1Ny1y5

Earlier today, I joined my Illinois House colleagues in supporting Illinois’ request for a major disaster declaration. Thank you @POTUS for quickly approving the request. This will allow Illinois to apply for individual & public assistance through @FEMA as we fight COVID-19. https://t.co/fp86pkxgyG

Across the US, folks are stepping up to help in the fight against COVID-19. In Southern IL, @biofuelresearch & Stumpy's Spirits Distillery are producing hand sanitizer. Southern Illinoisans know that we are stronger when we work together. #InItTogether ⬇️
https://t.co/iVQriaqnu5 https://t.co/kZkBRWDnch

Gov. Pritzker issued a Stay-At-Home order for all IL residents starting Saturday at 5pm until April 7. Essential services like grocery stores, hospitals, pharmacies & gas stations will stay open. Times are challenging, but we'll make it through together. https://t.co/Ppw8wYU4ti

Like many of you, my office is now my kitchen table. I’ve been talking to health professionals, emergency coordinators & federal officials. But, I wanted to take a moment to send you a message & speak from the heart. Stay strong, Southern Illinois. https://t.co/Fa7FSfGfoa

Many of our small businesses have had to temporarily close their doors or adapt their services in order to keep our communities safe from COVID-19. These shops, restaurants, and bars employ our families, neighbors, and friends.

Over 45% of our nation’s vets are 60 years or older – the age group that's most at risk of contracting a serious case of COVID-19. My @HouseVetAffairs & @VetAffairsDems colleagues & I are working w/ @DeptVetAffairs to identify their readiness & keep vets & their loved ones safe. https://t.co/J0UvrCrTAO
I’m also speaking with my House colleagues, and will be relaying our hospitals’ concerns to them.

In order to do our part to limit the spread of coronavirus, many of my meetings have turned into conference calls.
